author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: و ندارد در مقام خود ساکن و مستریح جمیع امور باسباب ظاهر و باهر و باسباب مقامات سیر و ادراک و مشاهده مختلف میشود در بصر ملاحظه نمائید جمیع اشیاء موجوده از ارض و سماء
translation: When man is asleep, his soul can, in no wise, be said to have been inherently affected by any external object. It is not susceptible of any change in its original state or character. Any variation in its functions is to be ascribed to external causes. It is to these external influences that any variations in its environment, its understanding, and perception should be attributed.
